translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Self-Punisher
â€œFear arose from self-punishment,
see the people who are confused.
I will proclaim the inspiration
as it was conquered by me.
Seeing the people who are trembling,
like fish in little water;ğŸ”½Seeing them oppressed by each other,
fear entered me.
The world is full of thorns,
all directions are closed off;
I wanted my own home,
I did not see a place of rest.
Seeing them oppressed right there,
disappointment arose in me;
Then I saw the arrow there,
hard to see, lodged in the heart.
By which arrow one is pierced,
one runs in all directions;
Having pulled out that very arrow,
one does not run or fall.
There the trainings are sung,
those things that are clung to in the world;
One should not be attached to them,
disenchanted with all sensual desires;
